metadata.Title: CVE-2020-26116 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
http.client in Python 3.x before 3.5.10, 3.6.x before 3.6.12, 3.7.x before 3.7.9, and 3.8.x before 3.8.5 allows CRLF injection if the attacker controls the HTTP request method, as demonstrated by inserting CR and LF control characters in the first argument of HTTPConnection.request.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-26116` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.9 - 3.9.0-5
libpython3.9 - 3.9.0-5
libpython3.9-minimal - 3.9.0-5
libpython3.9-stdlib - 3.9.0-5
libpython3.9-testsuite - 3.9.0-5
python3.9 - 3.9.0-5
python3.9-examples - 3.9.0-5
python3.9-full - 3.9.0-5
python3.9-minimal - 3.9.0-5
python3.9-venv - 3.9.0-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
python3.9 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.9.0-5').
